segment.source: Add or Remove Packages Offline Using DISM
segment.target: Add or Remove Packages Offline Using DISM

segment.source: Add or Remove Packages Offline Using DISM
segment.target: Add or Remove Packages Offline Using DISM

segment.source: Add or Remove Packages Offline Using DISM
segment.target: Add or Remove Packages Offline Using DISM

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) is a command-line tool that is used to update offline Windows® images.
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) is a command-line tool that is used to update offline Windows® images.

segment.source: There are two ways to install or remove packages offline with DISM.
segment.target: There are two ways to install or remove packages offline with DISM.

segment.source: You can either apply an unattend answer file to the offline image, or you can add or remove the package directly from the command prompt.
segment.target: You can either apply an unattend answer file to the offline image, or you can add or remove the package directly from the command prompt.

segment.source: If you are installing multiple packages to a Windows image, and there are dependency requirements, the best way to ensure the correct order of the installation is by using an answer file.
segment.target: If you are installing multiple packages to a Windows image, and there are dependency requirements, the best way to ensure the correct order of the installation is by using an answer file.

segment.source: You can use DISM to apply the Unattend.xml answer file to the image.
segment.target: You can use DISM to apply the Unattend.xml answer file to the image.

segment.source: When you use DISM to apply an answer file, the unattend settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass are applied to the Windows image.
segment.target: When you use DISM to apply an answer file, the unattend settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass are applied to the Windows image.

segment.source: You must install the latest version of the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK), which contains all of the tools that are required, including DISM.
segment.target: You must install the latest version of the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK), which contains all of the tools that are required, including DISM.

segment.source: To add packages to an offline image by using DISM
segment.target: To add packages to an offline image by using DISM

segment.source: At an elevated command prompt, locate the Windows ADK servicing folder, and type the following command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to modify.
segment.target: At an elevated command prompt, locate the Windows ADK servicing folder, and type the following command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to modify.

segment.source: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify an image file.
segment.target: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify an image file.

segment.source: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image.

segment.source: At a command prompt, type the following command to add a specific package to the image.
segment.target: At a command prompt, type the following command to add a specific package to the image.

segment.source: You can add multiple packages on one command line.
segment.target: You can add multiple packages on one command line.

segment.source: They will be installed in the order listed in the command line.
segment.target: They will be installed in the order listed in the command line.

segment.source: At a command prompt, type the following command to commit the changes and unmount the image.
segment.target: At a command prompt, type the following command to commit the changes and unmount the image.

segment.source: To remove packages from an offline image by using DISM
segment.target: To remove packages from an offline image by using DISM

segment.source: At an elevated command prompt, locate the Windows ADK servicing folder, and type the following command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to modify.
segment.target: At an elevated command prompt, locate the Windows ADK servicing folder, and type the following command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to modify.

segment.source: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify an image file.
segment.target: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify an image file.

segment.source: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image.

segment.source: Optional: Type the following command to list the packages in the image.
segment.target: Optional: Type the following command to list the packages in the image.

segment.source: You can use to redirect the output of the command to a text file that is named FeatureList.
segment.target: You can use to redirect the output of the command to a text file that is named FeatureList.

segment.source: Review the list of packages that are available in your mounted image and note the package identity of the package.
segment.target: Review the list of packages that are available in your mounted image and note the package identity of the package.

segment.source: At a command prompt, specify the package identity to remove it from the image.
segment.target: At a command prompt, specify the package identity to remove it from the image.

segment.source: You can remove multiple packages on one command line.
segment.target: You can remove multiple packages on one command line.

segment.source: You can use the /PackagePath option to point to the original source of the package, or to specify the path to the .cab file, or you can use the /PackageName option to specify the package by name as it is listed in the image.
segment.target: You can use the /PackagePath option to point to the original source of the package, or to specify the path to the .cab file, or you can use the /PackageName option to specify the package by name as it is listed in the image.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Operating System Package Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Operating System Package Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: At a command prompt, type the following command to commit the changes and unmount the image.
segment.target: At a command prompt, type the following command to commit the changes and unmount the image.

segment.source: To add or remove packages offline by using DISM and an answer file
segment.target: To add or remove packages offline by using DISM and an answer file

segment.source: Open Windows SIM.
segment.target: Open Windows SIM.

segment.source: To add a new package, click Insert on the main menu, and select Package(s).
segment.target: To add a new package, click Insert on the main menu, and select Package(s).

segment.source: Browse to the package you want to add, and then click Open.
segment.target: Browse to the package you want to add, and then click Open.

segment.source: To remove an existing package, select the package in the Answer file pane that you want to remove.
segment.target: To remove an existing package, select the package in the Answer file pane that you want to remove.

segment.source: In the Properties pane, change the Action property to Remove.
segment.target: In the Properties pane, change the Action property to Remove.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The packages must be added to the offlineServicing configuration pass.
segment.target: The packages must be added to the offlineServicing configuration pass.

segment.source: Validate and save the answer file.
segment.target: Validate and save the answer file.

segment.source: At an elevated command prompt, locate the Windows ADK servicing folder, and then type the following command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to mount.
segment.target: At an elevated command prompt, locate the Windows ADK servicing folder, and then type the following command to retrieve the name or index number for the image that you want to mount.

segment.source: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image.
segment.target: Type the following command to mount the offline Windows image.

segment.source: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify an image file.
segment.target: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify an image file.

segment.source: At a command prompt, type the following command to apply the unattended answer file to the image.
segment.target: At a command prompt, type the following command to apply the unattended answer file to the image.

segment.source: At a command prompt, type the following command to commit the changes and unmount the image.
segment.target: At a command prompt, type the following command to commit the changes and unmount the image.

segment.source: For more information about Windows SIM, see Windows Setup Technical Reference.
segment.target: For more information about Windows SIM, see Windows Setup Technical Reference.
